answers.answer: (Bullosis diabeticorum) blisters occur spontaneously and abruptly, often overnight.

Specific treatment of bullous disease of diabetes (bullosis diabeticorum) is unnecessary because the condition is self-limiting.http://emedicine.medscape.com/article/1062235-treatmentDo get it cross checked with your doc.
thankyou I have never heard of this but will look it up

question: hi I am diabetic and earlier this year I had a terrible itch all over my body but I have it under control now with cream and antihistamines .Now I have notice what looks like a rash on my fingers on one hand a few days ago.  Now it  looks just like burns that have blistered and burst and two fingers are swollen.  they do not hurt and I am sure that I have not done anything to cause it.I am not due back at dermatology till December but has anyone any idea what has caused it.
title: Skin problems
